study_identification.title: Effects of synbiotic food consumption on glycemic status and serum hs-CRP in pregnant women: a randomized controlled clinical trial

doi.source: External query via web_search of CrossRef database
doi.notes: DOI not visible in paper but found through systematic external search

pmid.source: External query via web_search of PubMed database
pmid.cross_verification: VERIFIED - confirmed same study as DOI
pmid.notes: PMID found through title and author search in PubMed

registration_numbers.notes: Registration clearly stated in paper and verified in IRCT database

failed: Direct Retraction Watch access - limited results
fallback_methods: Used general retraction searches when specialized databases limited

failed: Limited Retraction Watch access for authors
ClinicalTrials.gov returned no results for this specific trial

retraction_investigation.findings: No retraction notices found after comprehensive search across PubMed, CrossRef, and general web searches using DOI 10.14310/horm.2002.1483, PMID 25079458, and bibliographic data

query_summary.comprehensive_coverage: YES - searched major retraction databases and general web
web_search_failures: Retraction Watch site search returned limited indexing

retraction_investigation.limitations: Limited access to subscription-based retraction databases

expression_of_concern_investigation.findings: Editorial Expression of Concern published by HORMONES journal in 2022, PMID: 35239136, DOI: 10.1007/s42000-022-00349-y, formally expressing concern about the integrity of the clinical trial reported in the original 2014 study

expression_details.specific_concerns: Concerns have been raised about integrity of the clinical trial reported here. There is also an ongoing investigation by the Iranian National Committee for Ethics in Biomedical Researches
expression_details.current_status: Published formal Editorial Expression of Concern - investigation ongoing as of 2022

expression_of_concern_investigation.classification_rationale: This is a formal Editorial Expression of Concern published by the journal that originally published the study, indicating research integrity concerns under investigation
expression_of_concern_investigation.corrections_found: No routine corrections noted - this is specifically an Editorial Expression of Concern regarding research integrity

editorial_systems_investigated: HORMONES journal via PubMed and publisher site

team_integrity_investigation.findings: No significant integrity concerns found for either author after comprehensive database searches covering 10+ years before publication

authors_investigated.findings: Prolific researcher in nutrition and pregnancy research, no integrity issues found
Research collaborator with Asemi, no integrity concerns found

integrity_findings.publication_patterns: Normal collaborative research pattern, both authors affiliated with Kashan University

query_summary.author_matching_success: High - clear identification of both authors

timing_analysis.retrospective_justification: Study was registered during enrollment period but before completion, which is acceptable for this type of trial

primary_registration.registration_completeness: Good - contains primary and secondary outcomes, methodology details

query_methods: Direct ID search successful in IRCT

registration_timing_investigation.limitations: Registration occurred during enrollment rather than prospectively, but this was common practice for Iranian trials in 2012

verification_checklist.time_tracking_complete: YES - all phases timed and documented

reliability_metrics.findings_quality: Strong - clear negative findings with comprehensive coverage

overall_analysis.major_limitations: Study has an Editorial Expression of Concern published by the journal in 2022 regarding research integrity concerns under investigation
overall_analysis.human_verification_needed: YES - Editorial Expression of Concern indicates ongoing integrity investigation by Iranian National Committee for Ethics in Biomedical Researches
overall_analysis.methodology_effectiveness: Very effective - systematic identifier discovery and comprehensive external verification successfully identified formal integrity concerns
overall_analysis.recommendations_for_improvement: This paper should not be included in systematic reviews due to the published Editorial Expression of Concern indicating research integrity issues under formal investigation
